com.versant.var.message
Class VARTxMessage

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.var.queue.VARNode
      com.versant.var.message.VARTxMessage
Direct Known Subclasses:
VARDefaultTxMessage
public abstract class VARTxMessage
extends VARNode

This abstract class represents a transactional message to be transmitted/ received by a replica site. The methods process(), send() and receive() must be implemented by its subclasses. It extends com.versant.var.queue.VARNode so that a transaction message can be queued up on a persistent queue.

packObjects

public abstract void packObjects(java.util.Vector createdModified,
                                 java.util.Vector deleted)
Description copied from class: VARTxMessage
Pack objects
Pack the given objects in this message. The mechanism for pack the objects is upto the implementation. An example is to pack them as Java-serialized data.

Parameters:
createdModified - Vector of newly created and modified objects.
deleted - Vector of OIDs of deleted objects
See Also:
com.versant.var.message

unpackObjects

public abstract void unpackObjects()
Description copied from class: VARTxMessage
Unpack objects
Unpack the objects in this message. The opposite of packObjects(), it restores the objects stored in this message into a usable form. This methods does not return the objects. Instead, the method getObjects() is used to retrieve objects.

See Also:
com.versant.var.message

send

public abstract void send(java.io.OutputStream o)
Description copied from class: VARTxMessage
Send this message over an output stream.
When this method is called, it is assumed that the message is fully constructed and ready to go.

receive

public abstract void receive(java.io.InputStream i)
Description copied from class: VARTxMessage
Receive this message from an inout stream
This method is called on an "empty" message. After this method call it will be assumed that the message is fully constructed.
